hero.headline: Structured Product Labeling Made Simple
hero.subheadline: The intelligent platform for managing FDA SPL documents with AI-powered analysis, HL7 compliance, and enterprise-grade security.

features.title: SPL Parsing & Normalization
features.description: Import and process pharmaceutical labeling data from DailyMed ZIP files. Automatic parsing according to FDA SPL specifications with complete HL7 compliance.

features.title: Intelligent Data Analysis
features.description: Comprehensive navigation views for products, ingredients, packaging hierarchies, and labeler information. Search and filter across all label sections.

features.title: AI-Powered Interface
features.description: Natural language interaction with your pharmaceutical data. Ask questions like 'Find all products containing aspirin' and get structured responses.

features.title: Enterprise Security
features.description: Encrypted identifiers, OAuth authentication with Microsoft and Google, role-based access control, and comprehensive activity logging.

features.title: High Performance
features.description: Optimized batch processing, intelligent caching, and efficient data structures designed for Azure SQL and scalable cloud deployment.

features.title: Import & Export
features.description: Bulk import from DailyMed data sources with progress tracking. Generate valid SPL XML output from database records for regulatory submission.

howItWorks.title: How MedRecPro Works
howItWorks.subtitle: A modern approach to pharmaceutical labeling management

steps.title: Import SPL Data
steps.description: Upload ZIP files containing SPL XML documents from DailyMed. MedRecPro parses and normalizes the data according to FDA specifications.

steps.title: Explore & Analyze
steps.description: Navigate through products, ingredients, organizations, and packaging hierarchies using the REST API or AI-powered natural language queries.

steps.title: Manage & Update
steps.description: Full CRUD operations for all label sections. Track changes, compare versions, and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements.

steps.title: Export & Submit
steps.description: Generate valid SPL XML files from your database records. Export complete document packages ready for FDA submission.

sections.heading: 1. Acceptance of Terms
sections.content: By accessing and using MedRecPro, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provisions of this agreement.

sections.heading: 2. Use License
sections.content: MedRecPro is an open-source application for managing pharmaceutical Structured Product Labeling (SPL) data. The software is provided under the MIT License.

sections.heading: 3. Data Processing
sections.content: MedRecPro processes SPL XML files in accordance with FDA and HL7 specifications. Users are responsible for ensuring compliance with applicable regulations when using this tool.

sections.heading: 4. Authentication
sections.content: We use Microsoft and Google authentication to provide secure access. Your authentication data is handled in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

sections.heading: 5. Open Source
sections.content: This software is provided 'as is' without warranty of any kind. The source code is available on GitHub and contributions are welcome under the terms of the MIT License.

sections.heading: 6. Regulatory Compliance
sections.content: While MedRecPro is designed to work with FDA SPL data, users are responsible for ensuring their use complies with all applicable regulations, including 21 CFR Part 11 if applicable.

sections.heading: 7. Contact
sections.content: For questions about these terms, please contact: support@medrecpro.com

sections.heading: 1. Information We Collect
sections.content: When you authenticate with MedRecPro using Microsoft or Google, we collect your name, email address, and profile information provided by the authentication provider.

sections.heading: 2. How We Use Your Information
sections.content: We use your information to authenticate and authorize access to the application, maintain user sessions, and improve application functionality.

sections.heading: 3. Data Storage
sections.content: Your authentication data is stored securely on Microsoft Azure infrastructure in the East US 2 region. We implement industry-standard security measures including encryption at rest and in transit.

sections.heading: 4. Third-Party Services
sections.content: We use Microsoft and Google authentication services. Please refer to their respective privacy policies: Microsoft Privacy Statement (https://privacy.microsoft.com) and Google Privacy Policy (https://policies.google.com/privacy).

sections.heading: 5. SPL Data Processing
sections.content: MedRecPro processes pharmaceutical labeling data you upload or access. This data is processed according to FDA and HL7 specifications. You retain ownership of all data you upload or process through the system.

sections.heading: 6. Data Retention
sections.content: We retain your authentication information for as long as your account is active. You may request account deletion at any time by contacting support@medrecpro.com.

sections.heading: 7. Your Rights
sections.content: You have the right to access your personal data, request correction of your data, request deletion of your account, and export your data.

sections.heading: 8. Cookies and Tracking
sections.content: We use essential cookies for authentication and session management. We do not use advertising or tracking cookies.

sections.heading: 9. Security
sections.content: We implement industry-standard security measures including HTTPS encryption, secure authentication flows, and regular security audits.
